tuv.seg: Family reunification for people granted refugee status or subsidiary protection
Athaontú daoine le stádas dídeanaí nó cosaint choimhdí

A person who has international protection (refugee status or subsidiary protection) in Ireland can apply to the Minister for Justice and Equality for permission to have a member of their family enter and live in the State

Is féidir le duine a bhfuil stádas dídeanaí nó cosanta coimhdí acu iarratas a dhéanamh chun an Aire Dlí.agus Cirt agus Comhionannais do chead chun glacadh le teacht isteach agus le cónaí baill dá dteaghlach sa Stát
Since 31 December 2016, the International Protection Act 2015 sets out their right to apply for family reunification
Is in Alt 18 d’Acht na nDídeanaithe 1996 a leagtar amach ceart an dídeanaí chun iarratas a dhéanamh ar athaontú a dteaghlaigh

Under sections 56 and 57 of the Act, you may apply to the Minister if you have a current declaration as a convention refugee or a programme refugee or if you have a current subsidiary protection declaration

Is amhlaidh faoi alt 25 de Rialacháin an Aontais Eorpaigh ( Cosaint Choimhdeach) 2013, a bhíonn an ceart freisin ag an duine dá dtugtar cosaint choimhdeach (ar a dtugtar “an t-iarrthóir”) chun iarratas a dhéanamh ar athaontú teaghlaigh
People with permission to remain do not have a right to family reunification
Ní bhíonn ceart ag daoine le cead chun fanacht ar athaontú teaghlaigh
However, they may apply to have a member of their family join them in Ireland
Is féidir leo iarratas a dhéanamh ámh chun is go dtiocfadh ball dá dteaghlach chun fanacht leo in Éirinn
There is no legal definition as to who is a member of the family for people with permission to remain
Níl aon sainmhíniú dlíthiúil ann faoin duine ar dá dteaghlach iad i ndáil leis na daoine le cead chun fanacht
However, it is likely that such a definition would be similar to that of a person with refugee status or subsidiary protection
Is dócha ámh go mbeadh an sainmhíniú úd cosúil le ceann duine le stádas dídeanaí nó cosanta coimhdí
A member of the family in relation to a person who has refugee status or subsidiary protection (known as “the sponsor”) means:
Ciallaíonn ball teaghlaigh i ndáil le duine éigin le stádas dídeanaí nó cosanta coimhdí:
• Spouse or civil partner – provided that the marriage or civil partnership is in existence when the application for international protection is made

• Sa chás go mbíonn dídeanaí nó iarrthóir pósta nó i bpáirtnéireacht shibhialta, a gcéile nó a bpáirtí sibhialta, ar an gcuntar gurb ann don phósadh nó don pháirtnéireacht shibhialta nuair a dhéantar an t-iarratas ar athaontú teaghlaigh;
• Parent(s) – if the sponsor is aged under 18 and is not married on the date the application for family reunification is made
• Sa chás go bhfuil dídeanaí nó iarrthóir faoi bhun 18 bliain d’aois agus iad gan bheith pósta, a dtuismitheoirí;
• Child who is aged under 18 and not married on the date the application for family reunification is made
• Leanbh le dídeanaí nó le hiarrthóir atá faoi bhun 18 bliain d’aois agus iad gan bheith pósta lá an iarratais ar athaontú teaghlaigh
You must apply within 12 months of being granted a refugee or a subsidiary protection declaration or from the date of your arrival in Ireland as a programme refugee
Atreoraítear an t-iarratas ar athaontú teaghlaigh chuig An Coimisinéir um Iarratais ó Dhídeanaithe agus tugtar fógra d’Ard-Choimisinéir na Náisiún Aontaithe le haghaidh Dídeanaithe
You apply for permission for your family member (s) either:
Is é an Coimisinéir um Iarratais ó Dhídeanaithe a imscrúdóidh an t-iarratas agus a thaiscfidh tuairisc i scríbhinn chuig an Aire Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais

A sponsor in Ireland who wishes to make an application to have a family member join them must apply in writing to the Family Reunification Section of the Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service (INIS) - see 'Where to apply' below

Más mian le hurraitheoir iarratas a dhéanamh le go n-aontódh ball teaghlaigh leo, ní foláir d'iarratas scríofa chuig an Rannóg Athaontaithe Teaghlaigh don tSeirbhís Eadóirseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann (SEIÉ) - féach 'Cá háit a ndéanfaidh mé iarratas' thíos
Details of the documents required and the application process are in frequently asked questions on family reunification on the INIS website
Tá tuilleadh faoi na cáipéisí riachtanacha i gceisteanna coitianta um athaontú teaghlaigh ar shuíomh gréasáin SEIÉ
The sponsor will receive a letter from INIS informing them whether the application was successful
Gheobhaidh an t-urraitheoir litir ó SEIÉ a chuireann fios d'urratheoir go n-éireoidh nó nach n-éireoidh leis an iarratas
If the request for family reunification has been granted, the family member living abroad should then apply online for a visa to join the family member in Ireland
Má thugtar an t-iarratas ar athaontú teaghlaigh, caithfidh an ball teaghlaigh atá ina chónaí thar lear iarratas ar víosa ar líne a dhéanamh
There is information about family reunification for refugees on the INIS website
Tá faisnéis faoin athaontú teaghlaigh ar shuíomh gréasáin SEIÉ

The person who enters and resides in the State as a result of family reunification is entitled to remain in the State and to the same rights and privileges as a person who has international protection for as long as the refugee or sponsor who made the application is entitled to remain in the State

Bíonn an duine a iontrálann agus a chónaíonn sa stát mar thoradh ar athaontú teaghlaigh i dteidil chun fanacht sa Stát agus i dteidil do na cearta agus pribhléidí céanna le duine le cosaint idirnáisiúnta ar feadh chomh fada agus a bhíonn an t-urraitheoir a rinne an t-iarratas i dteidil chun fanacht sa Stát
